chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
m: nat
n: nat
f: nat -> R -> R
k: nat
x: R

Goal:
locally x (fun t : R_UniformSpace => forall l j : nat, (n <= l <= m)%nat -> (j <= k)%nat -> ex_derive_n (f l) j t) -> ex_derive_n (fun y : R => sum_n_m (fun j : nat => f j y) n m) k x

Premises:
R_UniformSpace = UniformSpace.Pack R R_UniformSpace_mixin R : UniformSpace
*** [ R : Set ]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
sum_n_m = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (a : nat -> G) (n m : nat) => iter_nat plus zero a n m : forall G : AbelianGroup, (nat -> G) -> nat -> nat -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope nat_scope nat_scope]
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.E.t = positive : Set
locally = fun (T : UniformSpace) (x : T) (P : T -> Prop) => exists eps : posreal, forall y : T, ball x eps y -> P y : forall T : UniformSpace, T -> (T -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope]
ex_derive_n = fun (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R_AbsRing) => match n with | 0%nat => True | S n0 => ex_derive (Derive_n f n0) x end : (R -> R) -> nat -> R_AbsRing -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope _]
is_derive_n_sum_n_m : forall (n m : nat) (f : nat -> R -> R) (k : nat) (x : R), locally x (fun t : R_UniformSpace => forall l j : nat, (n <= l <= m)%nat -> (j <= k)%nat -> ex_derive_n (f l) j t) -> is_derive_n (fun y : R => sum_n_m (fun j : nat => f j y) n m) k x (sum_n_m (fun j : nat => Derive_n (f j) k x) n m)
ex_derive_n_iter_plus : forall (l : list ?I) (f0 : ?I -> R -> R) (n0 : nat) (x0 : R), locally x0 (fun y : R_UniformSpace => forall (j : ?I) (k0 : nat), List.In j l -> (k0 <= n0)%nat -> ex_derive_n (f0 j) k0 y) -> ex_derive_n (fun y : R => iter Rplus 0 l (fun j : ?I => f0 j y)) n0 x0 where ?I : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R -> R k : nat x : R |- Type]
is_derive_n_iter_plus : forall (l : list ?I) (f0 : ?I -> R -> R) (n0 : nat) (x0 : R), locally x0 (fun y : R_UniformSpace => forall (j : ?I) (k0 : nat), List.In j l -> (k0 <= n0)%nat -> ex_derive_n (f0 j) k0 y) -> is_derive_n (fun y : R => iter Rplus 0 l (fun j : ?I => f0 j y)) n0 x0 (iter Rplus 0 l (fun j : ?I => Derive_n (f0 j) n0 x0)) where ?I : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R -> R k : nat x : R |- Type]
Derive_n_iter_plus : forall (l : list ?I) (f0 : ?I -> R -> R) (n0 : nat) (x0 : R), locally x0 (fun y : R_UniformSpace => forall (j : ?I) (k0 : nat), List.In j l -> (k0 <= n0)%nat -> ex_derive_n (f0 j) k0 y) -> Derive_n (fun y : R => iter Rplus 0 l (fun j : ?I => f0 j y)) n0 x0 = iter Rplus 0 l (fun j : ?I => Derive_n (f0 j) n0 x0) where ?I : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R -> R k : nat x : R |- Type]
ex_derive_n_plus : forall (f g : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R), locally x (fun y : R_UniformSpace => forall k : nat, (k <= n)%nat -> ex_derive_n f k y) -> locally x (fun y : R_UniformSpace => forall k : nat, (k <= n)%nat -> ex_derive_n g k y) -> ex_derive_n (fun x0 : R => f x0 + g x0) n x
Derive_n_plus : forall (f g : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R), locally x (fun y : R_UniformSpace => forall k : nat, (k <= n)%nat -> ex_derive_n f k y) -> locally x (fun y : R_UniformSpace => forall k : nat, (k <= n)%nat -> ex_derive_n g k y) -> Derive_n (fun x0 : R => f x0 + g x0) n x = Derive_n f n x + Derive_n g n x
is_derive_n_plus : forall (f g : R -> R) (n : nat) (x lf lg : R), locally x (fun y : R_UniformSpace => forall k : nat, (k <= n)%nat -> ex_derive_n f k y) -> locally x (fun y : R_UniformSpace => forall k : nat, (k <= n)%nat -> ex_derive_n g k y) -> is_derive_n f n x lf -> is_derive_n g n x lg -> is_derive_n (fun x0 : R => f x0 + g x0) n x (lf + lg)
ex_derive_n_ext_loc : forall (f g : R_UniformSpace -> R) (n : nat) (x : R_UniformSpace), locally x (fun t : R_UniformSpace => f t = g t) -> ex_derive_n f n x -> ex_derive_n g n x
filterdiff_iter_plus_fct : forall (l : list ?I) (f0 df : ?I -> ?U -> ?V), ?U -> (forall j : ?I, List.In j l -> filterdiff (f0 j) ?F (df j)) -> filterdiff (fun y : ?U => iter plus zero l (fun j : ?I => f0 j y)) ?F (fun x1 : ?U => iter plus zero l (fun j : ?I => df j x1)) where ?K : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R -> R k : nat x : R |- AbsRing] ?U : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R -> R k : nat x : R |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R ->...-> R k : nat x : R |- Filter ?F]
is_derive_n_ext_loc : forall (f g : R_UniformSpace -> R) (n : nat) (x : R_UniformSpace) (l : R), locally x (fun t : R_UniformSpace => f t = g t) -> is_derive_n f n x l -> is_derive_n g n x l
Derive_sum_n : forall (f : nat -> R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R), (forall k : nat, (k <= n)%nat -> ex_derive (f k) x) -> Derive (fun y : R => sum_n (fun k : nat => f k y) n) x = sum_n (fun k : nat => Derive (f k) x) n
Derive_n_ext_loc : forall (f g : R_UniformSpace -> R) (n : nat) (x : R_UniformSpace), locally x (fun t : R_UniformSpace => f t = g t) -> Derive_n f n x = Derive_n g n x
ex_derive_n_ext : forall (f g : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R_AbsRing), (forall t : R, f t = g t) -> ex_derive_n f n x -> ex_derive_n g n x
Derive_ext_loc : forall (f g : R_UniformSpace -> R) (x : R_UniformSpace), locally x (fun t : R_UniformSpace => f t = g t) -> Derive f x = Derive g x
ex_derive_n_opp : forall (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R), ex_derive_n f n x -> ex_derive_n (fun x0 : R => - f x0) n x
is_derive_ext_loc : forall (f0 g : ?K -> ?V) (x0 : ?K) (l : ?V), locally x0 (fun t : ?K => f0 t = g t) -> is_derive f0 x0 l -> is_derive g x0 l where ?K : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R -> R k : nat x : R |- AbsRing] ?V : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R -> R k : nat x : R |- NormedModule ?K]
locally_pt_comp : forall (P : R -> Prop) (f : R -> R) (x : R), locally (f x) P -> continuity_pt f x -> locally x (fun x0 : R_UniformSpace => P (f x0))
is_derive_sum_n : forall (f0 : nat -> ?K -> ?V) (n0 : nat) (x0 : ?K) (d : nat -> ?V), (forall k0 : nat, (k0 <= n0)%nat -> is_derive (f0 k0) x0 (d k0)) -> is_derive (fun y : ?K => sum_n (fun k : nat => f0 k y) n0) x0 (sum_n d n0) where ?K : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R -> R k : nat x : R |- AbsRing] ?V : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R -> R k : nat x : R |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_derive_ext_loc : forall (f0 g : ?K -> ?V) (x0 : ?K), locally x0 (fun t : ?K => f0 t = g t) -> ex_derive f0 x0 -> ex_derive g x0 where ?K : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R -> R k : nat x : R |- AbsRing] ?V : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R -> R k : nat x : R |- NormedModule ?K]
sum_f_n_Sm : forall (u : nat -> R) (n m : nat), (n <= m)%nat -> sum_f n (S m) u = sum_f n m u + u (S m)
continuity_pt_ext_loc : forall (f g : R_UniformSpace -> R) (x : R_UniformSpace), locally x (fun x0 : R_UniformSpace => f x0 = g x0) -> continuity_pt f x -> continuity_pt g x
is_derive_n_unique : forall (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x l : R), is_derive_n f n x l -> Derive_n f n x = l
locally_locally : forall (x0 : ?T) (P : ?T -> Prop), locally x0 P -> locally x0 (fun y : ?T => locally y P) where ?T : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R -> R k : nat x : R |- UniformSpace]
iter_const : forall (l : list ?I) (a : R), iter Rplus 0 l (fun _ : ?I => a) = INR (length l) * a where ?I : [n : nat m : nat f : nat -> R -> R k : nat x : R |- Type]
Nat.le_trans : forall n m p : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> (m <= p)%nat -> (n <= p)%nat
sum_n_m_le : forall (a b : nat -> R) (n m : nat), (forall k : nat, a k <= b k) -> sum_n_m a n m <= sum_n_m b n m
le_S : forall n m : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> (n <= S m)%nat
Nat.le_antisymm : forall n m : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> (m <= n)%nat -> n = m
le_S_n : forall n m : nat, (S n <= S m)%nat -> (n <= m)%nat
is_derive_n = fun (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x l : R) => match n with | 0%nat => f x = l | S n0 => is_derive (Derive_n f n0) x l end : (R -> R) -> nat -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope R_scope R_scope]
